resources.string:
Our goal is to build an inexpensive communication network between a region of people that do not necessarily have access to Internet. This can happen because of mountain regions, because the internet is no longer trustable, because it became unavailable due to natural conditions, or due to human destruction of the network infrastructure. 

 Previously we have experimented with LoRa. But that equipment is expensive, exotic, and difficult to maintain. Most people around us refused to buy the units, and they were not often used. 

 Our current approach is to use the smartphones we already carry in our pockets. These devices are well maintained by their owners, ensuring they have battery and function properly. 

 However, those devices rely entirely on Internet connectivity for communication. If or when the Internet is unavailable, people will still use their phones to take pictures, listen to music, play games, and share things with their friends and family. 

 Even without Internet, people will meet in person to exchange messages with each other or send pendrives with text files or pictures to other communities far away. 

 What we are doing with geogram is creating software for this scenario. A scenario where, with or without Internet access, we have an app that allows people to digitally carry and share messages between each other. The right time to develop such software for off-grid usage is now while peace lasts, not later during emergencies or war when we are more worried about basic things like survival.
Please be careful, the buttons below are only meant for debug purposes.
Offline-first communication through Bluetooth mesh networking. Messages relay through nearby devices even without internet.
To enable mesh networking, we need a few permissions:
Required for discovering and connecting to nearby devices via BLE mesh networking. This is the core functionality for offline message relay.
Android requires location permission for Bluetooth scanning. We optionally use it to tag messages with geographic coordinates for relay routing.
Allows the app to run in the background for continuous message relay. You can disable relay mode if you prefer.
Used for NOSTR messaging when available. The app works fully offline without internet access.
All data stays on your device. Messages are end-to-end encrypted. We do not collect or transmit personal information.
